posts.post_content:
This guy is a one-hit kill with [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike) and any other power boost of 2 or more.  
  
Turn 3 win is possible in mostly-standard casual if you go second. (I realize that pulling this off exactly is phenomenally unlikely, but still.)  
T1: Forest, [Joraga Treespeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Joraga Treespeaker)  
T2: Swamp, give the Treespeaker a level, tap it for [Lightning Greaves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Greaves)  
T3: Land, [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual), [Elvish Piper](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elvish Piper). Equip the greaves to the piper and trick this into play. Cast [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) and [Tainted Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tainted Strike), equip the greaves, and swing for the win.
posts.html:
This guy is a one-hit kill with Tainted Strike and any other power boost of 2 or more.

Turn 3 win is possible in mostly-standard casual if you go second. (I realize that pulling this off exactly is phenomenally unlikely, but still.)
T1: Forest, Joraga Treespeaker
T2: Swamp, give the Treespeaker a level, tap it for Lightning Greaves
T3: Land, Dark Ritual, Elvish Piper. Equip the greaves to the piper and trick this into play. Cast Giant Growth and Tainted Strike, equip the greaves, and swing for the win.

Posted By: wholelottalove (9/29/2012 7:40:17 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
4.5 for this card? That seems a tad too high. It's a decent finisher, but... it feel like a 6 mana card for green. 7 doesn't break the bank, but even at 6 it's competing with truly epic creatures.   
  
Compare to [Thornling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thornling)  
-Much easier to cast.  
-Protects itself.  
-Trample (which is pseudo evasion)  
-Can have haste  
-Versatile  
  
A big beater with psuedo evasion is nice, but I think by showing you Thornling you get what I mean. It could be more interesting, like [Engulfing Slagwurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Engulfing Slagwurm). They aren't necessarily better, but they sure seem a lot more worth it.
posts.html:
4.5 for this card? That seems a tad too high. It's a decent finisher, but... it feel like a 6 mana card for green. 7 doesn't break the bank, but even at 6 it's competing with truly epic creatures.

Compare to Thornling
-Much easier to cast.
-Protects itself.
-Trample (which is pseudo evasion)
-Can have haste
-Versatile

A big beater with psuedo evasion is nice, but I think by showing you Thornling you get what I mean. It could be more interesting, like Engulfing Slagwurm. They aren't necessarily better, but they sure seem a lot more worth it.
